abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Smallholder Cattle Development Project which promotes
            cattle production, marketing, beef processing and support
            service systems in China. This report describes the measures
            planned to mitigate negative environmental impacts
            associated with this project. Every dust outlet will have a
            dust absorption cover and pipeline system connected to a
            dust collector. Installing silencers and noise-proof
            facilities will reduce noise and establishing regulations
            will direct the use of protective equipment. In workshop
            areas and wherever there is a high concentration of ambient
            dust, dust monitoring and alarm systems will be installed.
            Fire hazard and control measures include hydrants, fire
            extinguishers, and pressure equalization openings.
            Feedlot-discharged wastewater coming from cattle urine, shed
            washing, cattle cooling, and worker living will be mitigated
            by daily watering and site cleaning. There will be regular
            monitoring of groundwater quality and odors, and structures
            intended to treat sewage, like sedimentation ponds and berm
            dikes will be installed along with a manure disposal plan.
            Cattle waste and feed residual can be mixed and piled and
            used as organic fertilizer. Trees will be planted around the
            feedlot and the market. Environmental training will be
            provided to farmers and administrative staff. A resettlement
            plan will compensate project affected persons.
